description: go: add ... patterns in import path arguments

messages.text:
http://codereview.appspot.com/5530058/diff/5001/src/cmd/go/help.go
File src/cmd/go/help.go (right):

http://codereview.appspot.com/5530058/diff/5001/src/cmd/go/help.go#newcode36
src/cmd/go/help.go:36: the "..." wildcards.
that's not a clear description for someone unfamiliar with the notation.

what is really is just * that matches / as well. maybe you can find a better explanation.

http://codereview.appspot.com/5530058/diff/5001/src/cmd/go/main.go
File src/cmd/go/main.go (right):

http://codereview.appspot.com/5530058/diff/5001/src/cmd/go/main.go#newcode248
src/cmd/go/main.go:248: // matchPattern(pattern)(name) return true if
s/return/&s/

http://codereview.appspot.com/5530058/diff/5001/src/cmd/go/main.go#newcode263
src/cmd/go/main.go:263: // what is either "all" (all packages), "std" (standard packages)
'what' makes for clumsy docs. if you want to keep the name(fine), i suggest
... matching the string what, which is either "all" ....

*** Submitted as 5c292c9954f0 ***
